dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4032 IH: Lowering Broadband Costs for Consumers Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Feenstra (for himself, Ms. Leger Fernandez, Mr. Mann, Mr. Rogers of Kentucky, and Ms. Stansbury) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Federal Communications Commission to ensure equitable and nondiscriminatory contributions to the mechanisms that preserve and advance universal service, to reduce the financial burden on consumers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lowering Broadband Costs for Consumers Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: The term broadband internet access service has the meaning given the term in section 8.1(b) of title 47, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation.
The term broadband provider means a provider of broadband internet access service.
The term Commission means the Federal Communications Commission.
The term edge provider means a provider of online content or services, including—

subparagraph.text: an over-the-top messaging service or any other service that enables texting;

paragraph.text: The term eligible telecommunications carrier means a common carrier designated as an eligible telecommunications carrier under section 214(e) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 214(e)).

subsection.text: Section 254(d) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 254(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Every and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of the Lowering Broadband Costs for Consumers Act of 2025, the Commission shall complete a rulemaking to reform the Universal Service Fund by expanding the contribution base so that broadband providers and edge providers, except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, contribute on an equitable and nondiscriminatory basis to the specific, predictable, and sufficient mechanisms established by the Commission to preserve and advance universal service.

From time to time after the rulemaking described in subparagraph (A), the Commission may revise the rules adopted under that subparagraph, as necessary, to ensure that broadband providers and edge providers continue to contribute on an equitable and nondiscriminatory basis to the specific, predictable, and sufficient mechanisms established by the Commission to preserve and advance universal service.

paragraph.header: Exempted edge providers and broadband providers
paragraph.text: The requirement to contribute described in paragraph (2) shall not apply to—

clause.text: transmitted less than 3 percent of the estimated quantity of broadband data that was transmitted in the United States during the most recent year, as determined by the Commission; and
earned less than $5,000,000,000 in revenue in the United States during the most recent year; or

subparagraph.text: an edge provider or broadband provider or class of edge providers or broadband providers if the revenue of the provider is such that the level of contribution of the provider to the preservation and advancement of universal service would be de minimis.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the terms broadband provider and edge provider have the meanings given those terms in section 2 of the Lowering Broadband Costs for Consumers Act of 2025.

Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Commission shall complete a rulemaking to adopt a new mechanism under the high-cost program of the Universal Service Fund that will provide specific, predictable, and sufficient support for expenses incurred by a broadband provider that is an eligible telecommunications carrier in providing supported services to the extent that such expenses are not otherwise recovered from revenues earned from the assessment of just, reasonable, and affordable rates on end users in high-cost areas or from other universal service support mechanisms.
The Commission shall ensure that not more than 1 eligible telecommunications carrier for any area receives support from the mechanism adopted through the rulemaking conducted under paragraph (1).

subsection.header: Enforcement by the Federal Communications Commission

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided, the Commission shall enforce this Act in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same jurisdiction, powers, and duties as though all applicable terms and provisions of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 151 et seq.) were incorporated into and made a part of this Act.
Any person who violates this Act shall be subject to the penalties and entitled to the privileges and immunities provided in the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 151 et seq.).

The purpose of this section is to direct the Commission to require contributions to the Universal Service Fund from edge providers and broadband providers and to modify the high cost program to promote affordable and available broadband.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to provide the Commission with—

subparagraph.text: any new authority over broadband providers; or
any authority over edge providers other than as described in paragraph (1).
